Data Structures | Macros | Functions
PMU Utility Functions
utils

Detailed Description

Purpose: This module provides power management utilities for Ambiq Micro devices. It enables efficient power state control, voltage regulation, and energy optimization for embedded applications requiring sophisticated power management.

Key Features

  1. Power States: Multiple power mode support.
  2. Voltage Control: Dynamic voltage regulation.
  3. Energy Optimization: Power consumption management.
  4. Mode Transitions: Smooth power state changes.
  5. Monitoring: Power status tracking.

Functionality

  • Control power states
  • Manage voltage levels
  • Optimize energy usage
  • Handle mode transitions
  • Monitor power status

Usage

  1. Initialize PMU settings
  2. Configure power modes
  3. Manage state transitions
  4. Monitor power conditions

Configuration

  • Set up power modes
  • Configure voltage levels
  • Define transition behavior
  • Set monitoring parameters

Function Documentation

◆ am_util_pmu_deinit()

uint32_t am_util_pmu_deinit ( void )
extern

De-initialize performance monitoring unit.

Parameters
None

This function de-initializes PMU usage. It must be called for each corresponding call to am_util_pmu_init() after PMU measurements have concluded.

Returns
AM_HAL_STATUS_SUCCESS or others non-success status.

◆ am_util_pmu_disable()

uint32_t am_util_pmu_disable ( void )
extern

Disable PMU.

This function can be used to disable performance monitoring unit.

Returns
AM_HAL_STATUS_SUCCESS

◆ am_util_pmu_get_profiling()

uint32_t am_util_pmu_get_profiling ( am_util_pmu_config_t * pPMUConfig,
am_util_pmu_profiling_t * pprofiling )
extern

Change the power state of the UART module.

Parameters
pPMUConfigis the handle for the PMU events configurations.
pprofilingis the events profiling.

This function can be used get information about events that are taking place in the processor and can be used for performance analysis and system debug.

Returns
AM_HAL_STATUS_SUCCESS or others non-success status.

◆ am_util_pmu_init()

uint32_t am_util_pmu_init ( am_util_pmu_config_t * pPMUConfig)
extern

initialize performance monitoring unit

Parameters
pPMUConfigis the handle for the PMU events configurations.

This function can be used to configure each performance event counter to count any of the performance events that might be supported by an implementation. the dedicated 32-bit cycle counter is hard-wared to count cycles. In case of counter chain event, the architecture guarantee that the unsigned overflow of the lower half of the counter and subsequent increment of the upper half of the counter are counted within the same cycle.

Returns
AM_HAL_STATUS_SUCCESS or others non-success status.
